title: INVENTORY / MULLEN IDENTITY
description: "Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity". Dick Mullen is mistaken for someone (an identity).

dialogueTree.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "In your hand, you hold four-fifths..."
dialogueTree.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
dialogueTree.english: In your hand, you hold four-fifths of "Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity."
dialogueTree.polish: W dłoni trzymasz cztery piąte książki „Dick Mullen i pomylona tożsamość”.
dialogueTree.belarusian: У руцэ ты трымаеш чатыры пятыя кнігі "Дык Мулен і заблытаная асоба".

links.title: You: "Examine the cover."
links.english: Examine the cover.
links.polish: Przyjrzyj się okładce.
links.belarusian: Паглядзі на вокладку.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "The cover features a pastiche of di..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: The cover features a pastiche of different scenes. In the foreground, a man in a dark overcoat clutches a pistol to his chest. Rising up behind him are two silhouettes wrapped in a passionate embrace.
links.polish: Na okładce widnieje złożony z kilku planów pastisz. Mężczyzna w ciemnym płaszczu przyciska do piersi pistolet, za nim zaś dwie sylwetki splatają się w namiętnym uścisku.
links.belarusian: На вокладцы намаляваны шматпланава стылізаваны вобраз. Мужчына ў цёмным паліто прыціскае да грудзей пісталет, за ім жа два сілуэты злучаюцца ў страсным абдымку.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "The tagline reads: "Detective Dick..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: The tagline reads: "Detective Dick Mullen must prove his innocence after an old friend is murdered -- by someone who looks just like Dick Mullen!" That seems to sum up the premise nicely.
links.polish: Podsumowujący fabułę slogan brzmi: „Detektyw Dick Mullen musi udowodnić swoją niewinność po tym, jak jego stary przyjaciel zostaje zabity... przez kogoś wyglądającego jak on!”. Brzmi to jak niezłe podsumowanie.
links.belarusian: Рэзюмуючы сюжэт, слоган гучыць: "Дэтэктыў Дзік Маллен павінен даказаць сваю невінаватасць пасля таго, як яго стары сябар становіцца забітым... кімсьці, хто выглядае, як ён!" Гэта гучыць як добрае рэзюмэ.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Needless to say, it violates nearly..."
links.english: Needless to say, it violates nearly every RCM regulation for a detective to investigate a murder in which he is a suspect.
links.polish: Nie trzeba chyba wspominać, że prowadzenie śledztwa w sprawie morderstwa, o które jest się podejrzanym, stanowi naruszenie niemal każdej z obowiązujących MOR zasad.
links.belarusian: Напэўна, не трэба згаадваць, што правядзенне расследавання па справе аб забойстве, у якім сам з'яўляешся падазраваным, з'яўляецца парушэннем амаль кожнага з дзеючых РГМ правілаў.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Are you really reading that, detec..."
links.english: "Are you really reading that, detective?"
links.polish: „Naprawdę to czytasz, detektywie?”
links.belarusian: "Насамрэч ты гэта чытаеш, дэтэктыве?"

links.title: You: ""I really need to know who this Dic..."
links.english: "I really need to know who this Dick Mullen guy is."
links.polish: „Muszę się koniecznie dowiedzieć, kim jest ten Dick Mullen”.
links.belarusian: "Мне трэба абавязкова даведацца, хто такі Дзік Мулен".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Good luck finding it. He's not muc..."
links.english: "Good luck finding it. He's not much of a character, I think you'll find. Just a stand-in for the reader."
links.polish: „Powodzenia w poszukiwaniach. Szybko się, myślę, zorientujesz, że to dość marna postać. Taka kukiełka, w którą może wczuć się czytelnik”.
links.belarusian: "Поспеху ў пошуках. Хутка, мяркую, зразумееце, што гэта даволі мізэрны персанаж. Такая лялька, у якую можа ўжыцца чытач".

links.title: Conceptualization: "The point is for the reader to feel..."
links.english: The point is for the reader to feel like *they're* solving the crime along with Dick Mullen. A crude narrative convention, but no less effective for it.
links.polish: Cel jest taki, żeby czytelnik poczuł, jakby to *on* rozwiązywał zagadkę razem z Dickiem Mullenem. To prymitywna konwencja narracyjna, niemniej skuteczna.
links.belarusian: Мэта заключаецца ў тым, каб чытач адчуў, быццам гэта *ён* разам з Дзікам Муленам разгадвае загадку. Гэта прымітыўная наратыўная канвенцыя, але эфектыўная.

links.title: You: ""I'm looking for advice on being a..."
links.english: "I'm looking for advice on being a real detective."
links.polish: „Szukam porad, jak być prawdziwym detektywem”.
links.belarusian: "Шукаю парад, як быць сапраўдным дэтэктывам".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Well, you won't find it in *there*..."
links.english: "Well, you won't find it in *there*. Those books are much more about ravishing dames and gun play than real policework."
links.polish: „Cóż, *tam* na pewno się tego nie dowiesz. To książki raczej o pięknych kobietach i zabawie bronią niż o prawdziwej policyjnej robocie”.
links.belarusian: "Ну, *там* вы гэтага напэўна не даведаецеся. Гэта хутчэй кнігі пра прыгожых жанчын і забаўкі са зброяй, чым пра сапраўдную паліцэйскую працу".

links.title: Electrochemistry: "When was the last time *you* ravish..."
links.english: When was the last time *you* ravished a dame, detective? Besides your crusty old sock, that is.
links.polish: A kiedy *ty* ostatni raz wziąłeś namiętnie kobietę, detektywie? Twoja stara oblepiona skarpetka się nie liczy.
links.belarusian: А калі *ты* апошні раз запалкава ўзяў жанчыну, дэтэктыве? Твая старая заклееная шкарпэтка не лічыцца.

links.title: You: ""I'm just skimming it.""
links.english: "I'm just skimming it."
links.polish: „Przeglądam tylko”.
links.belarusian: "Проста праглядаю".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That's probably for the best. Thos..."
links.english: "That's probably for the best. Those books aren't exactly famed for their tight plotting."
links.polish: „To chyba najlepsze rozwiązanie. Te książki nie słyną raczej z misternie splecionej fabuły”.
links.belarusian: "Верагодна, гэта найлепшае рашэнне. Гэтыя кнігі звычайна не славяцца складаным сюжэтам".

links.title: Drama: "It's much more about the dark and d..."
links.english: It's much more about the dark and deadly atmossssphere.
links.polish: Chodzi dużo bardziej o mroczną i zabójczą atmosssssferę.
links.belarusian: Гаворка ідзе значна больш пра змрочную і смяротную атмасферу.

links.title: You: "Start reading."
links.english: Start reading.
links.polish: Zacznij czytać.
links.belarusian: Пачні чытаць.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Why? There's truly no point. You'll..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: Why? There's truly no point. You'll never know who did it, because those pages have literally been scattered to the wind.
links.polish: Po co? Naprawdę nie ma sensu. Nigdy nie dowiesz się, kto jest winowajcą, bo strony książki zupełnie dosłownie porwał wiatr.
links.belarusian: Навошта? Сапраўды няма сэнсу. Ніколі не даведаешся, хто віноўнік, бо старонкі кнігі зусім літаральна парваў вецер.

links.title: You: "I just want to relive the experienc..."
links.english: I just want to relive the experience.
links.polish: Chcę po prostu przeżyć to jeszcze raz.
links.belarusian: Я проста хачу перажыць гэта яшчэ раз.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "If you insist. But again, it's real..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: If you insist. But again, it's really pointless...
links.polish: Skoro nalegasz. Ale powtórzę – to naprawdę bezcelowe...
links.belarusian: Калі аднойчы настойваеш. Але паўтару – гэта сапраўды марна...

links.title: You: "You're right. I should just quit. (..."
links.english: You're right. I should just quit. (Close the book.)
links.polish: Racja. Lepiej dam spokój. (Zamknij książkę).
links.belarusian: Сапраўды. Лепш пакінь гэта. (Закрый кнігу).

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "The story opens with a knock at the..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: The story opens with a knock at the door. Detective Dick Mullen is greeted by an old friend, Charlie Spillane, who's come to Mullen to ask a favour on this dark and cold night...
links.polish: Fabuła rozpoczyna się pukaniem do drzwi. Detektywa Dicka Mullena wita jego stary przyjaciel, Charlie Spillane, który w tę mroczną i zimną noc przybył, aby poprosić o przysługę...
links.belarusian: Сюжэт пачынаецца з грукату ў дзверы. Дэтэктыва Дзіка Малена вітае яго стары сябар, Чарлі Спілан, які ў гэтую змрочную і халодную ноч прыйшоў, каб папрасіць аб паслузе...

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Spillane needs Mullen to drive him..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: Spillane needs Mullen to drive him in from Vesper to a small town along the Insulindian coast. Despite his friend's apparent agitation, Mullen does as he's asked, then returns home where he passes out drunk, as he does most nights...
links.polish: Spillane chce, aby Mullen zawiózł go z Wesperu do małego miasteczka na insulindiańskim wybrzeżu. Nie zważając na ewidentnie podniecenie przyjaciela, detektyw spełnia prośbę, po czym wraca do domu, gdzie upija się i traci przytomność, tak, jak to robi zazwyczaj...
links.belarusian: Спіллайн хоча, каб Мален адвёз яго з Веспера ў маленькі гарадок на ўзбярэжжы Інсаліндіі. Не зважаючы на відавочнае ўзбуджэнне сябра, дэтэктыў выконвае просьбу, пасля чаго вяртаецца дадому, дзе напіваецца і губляе прытомнасць, як робіць гэта звычайна...

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "An extremely unprofessional and *hu..."
links.english: An extremely unprofessional and *hurtful* stereotype that's offensive to all upstanding officers of the law.
links.polish: Wyjątkowo nieprofesjonalny i *krzywdzący* stereotyp, afront dla wszystkich szanujących się funkcjonariuszy policji.
links.belarusian: Вельмі непрафесійны і *крыўдны* стэрэатып, абраза для ўсіх паважлівых супрацоўнікаў паліцыі.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "But also extremely *accurate*, in y..."
links.english: But also extremely *accurate*, in your case.
links.polish: Choć akurat w twoim wypadku wyjątkowo *trafny*.
links.belarusian: Хоць у тваім выпадку выключна *дакладны*.

links.title: You: "Hey, I'm trying at least."
links.english: Hey, I'm trying at least.
links.polish: Hej, przynajmniej się staram.
links.belarusian: Прывітанне, прынамсі я стараюся.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Are you, though?"
links.english: Are you, though?
links.polish: Czy na pewno?
links.belarusian: Вы ўпэўнены?

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Give it time. You'll fall off the w..."
links.english: Give it time. You'll fall off the wagon sooner or later.
links.polish: Poczekaj tylko. Prędzej czy później się znowu potkniesz.
links.belarusian: Пачакай толькі. Рана ці позна ты зноў спатыкнешся.

links.title: You: "Look, I can't judge."
links.english: Look, I can't judge.
links.polish: Nie mam prawa go oceniać.
links.belarusian: Я не маю права яго ацэньваць.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Two days later, Mullen is arrested..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: Two days later, Mullen is arrested by the Vesper police and charged with the murder of Charlie Spillane. At his interrogation, Mullen learns that Charlie Spillane was shot in a bar in the very town Mullen dropped him off in, by a man matching *Mullen's* description...
links.polish: Dwa dni później Mullen zostaje aresztowany przez wesperską policję i oskarżony o zamordowanie Charliego Spillane'a. Podczas swojego przesłuchania dowiaduje się, że został on zastrzelony w barze, w mieście, w do którego podwoził go detektyw. Przez człowieka wyglądającego jak *Mullen*...
links.belarusian: Праз два дні Маллен быў арыштаваны весперскай паліцыяй і абвінавачаны ў забойстве Чарлі Спілейна. Падчас свайго допыту ён даведваецца, што Супілэйна застрэлілі ў бары, у горадзе, куды яго падвёз дэтэктыў. Чалавекам, які выглядаў як *Маллен*...

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Desperate to clear his name, Mullen..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: Desperate to clear his name, Mullen manages to convince the Vesper police to release him for *three days* so that Mullen may solve his friend's murder and prove his innocence.
links.polish: Desperacko pragnący oczyścić się z podejrzeń Mullen przekonuje wesperskich policjantów, aby wypuścili go na *trzy dni*, w trakcie których rozwiąże on zagadkę morderstwa jego przyjaciela i udowodni swoją niewinność.
links.belarusian: Адчайна імкнучыся ачысціць сябе ад падазрэнняў, Мулен пераконвае весперскіх паліцэйскіх, каб тыя адпусцілі яго на *тры дні*, падчас якіх ён разбярэцца ў забойстве свайго сябра і дакажа сваю невінаватасць.

links.title: You: ""The cops release their prime murde..."
links.english: "The cops release their prime murder suspect so he can find 'the real killer'? Are you shitting me?"
links.polish: „Policjanci wypuszczają głównego podejrzanego o morderstwo, żeby ten mógł poszukać »prawdziwego zabójcy«? Jaja sobie robicie?”
links.belarusian: "Міліцыянты выпускаюць галоўнага падазраванага ў забойстве, каб той мог знайсці "сапраўднага забойцу"? Вы што, жартуеце?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What's the matter, detective?" The..."
links.english: "What's the matter, detective?" The lieutenant turns to you with a start.
links.polish: „Co się stało, detektywie?” – porucznik odwraca się do ciebie gwałtownie.
links.belarusian: "Што здарылася, дэтэктыў?" — лейтэнант рэзка паварочваецца да вас.

links.title: You: ""I don't know who's writing this sh..."
links.english: "I don't know who's writing this shit, but I get the feeling they aren't experts on homicide investigations."
links.polish: „Nie wiem, kto pisze te gówna, ale mam przeczucie, że nie jest ekspertem, jeśli chodzi o śledztwa w sprawie morderstw”.
links.belarusian: "Не ведаю, хто піша гэты бруд, але ў мяне ёсць адчуванне, што ён не з'яўляецца экспертам у расследаваннях забойстваў".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant shrugs, resigned to..."
links.english: The lieutenant shrugs, resigned to the idea that his profession will rarely, if ever, be accurately represented in art and literature.
links.polish: Porucznik wzrusza ramionami. Jest pogodzony z myślą, że jego zawód rzadko, o ile kiedykolwiek, będzie wiarygodnie przedstawiany w sztuce i literaturze.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант паціскае плячыма. Ён змірыліся з думкай, што яго прафесія рэдка, калі наогул калі-небудзь, будзе праўдзіва прадстаўлена ў мастацтве і літаратуры.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "They're not shitting you, detective..."
links.english: They're not shitting you, detective. This is what the writers think passes for police procedure.
links.polish: Nie robią, detektywie. Zdaniem autorów tak wyglądają policyjne procedury.
links.belarusian: Яны не робяць, дэтэктыве. Паводле аўтараў, так выглядаюць паліцэйскія працэдуры.

links.title: You: "Okay, so Mullen didn't do it. (Keep..."
links.english: Okay, so Mullen didn't do it. (Keep reading.)
links.polish: No dobra, w takim razie Mullen tego nie zrobił. (Czytaj dalej).
links.belarusian: Ну добра, у такім выпадку Маллен гэтага не зрабіў. (Чытай далей).

links.title: You: "No way Mullen did it. (Keep reading..."
links.english: No way Mullen did it. (Keep reading.)
links.polish: Nie wierzę, że to Mullen był winowajcą. (Czytaj dalej).
links.belarusian: Не веру, што гэта Муллен быў віноўнікам. (Чытай далей).

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Of *course* Mullen didn't do it. Th..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: Of *course* Mullen didn't do it. That's the whole premise of the book! Anyway, Mullen returns to the seaside bar where Spillane was murdered, and meets a *beautiful*, *mysterious* woman named Deanna Deneuve.
links.polish: *Oczywiście*, że to nie Mullen był winowajcą. O to chodzi w książce! W każdym razie Mullen wraca do nadmorskiego baru, gdzie zamordowano Spillane'a, i spotyka tam *piękną*, *tajemniczą* kobietę, niejaką Deannę Deneuve.
links.belarusian: *Вядома*, што гэта быў не Муллен. Гэта сутнасць кнігі! У любым выпадку, Муллен вяртаецца ў прыбярэжны бар, дзе быў забіты Спіллэйн, і сустракае там *прыгожую*, *таямнічую* жанчыну, нейкую Дэану Дэнав.

links.title: You: "Nice, a dame."
links.english: Nice, a dame.
links.polish: No proszę, jakaś dama.
links.belarusian: Вось гэта дама.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "And not just any dame -- she's trul..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: And not just any dame -- she's truly one-in-a-million, a knock-out whose *mind* is as dangerous as her *curves*. But she's got a *secret*.
links.polish: I to nie byle jaka – to kobieta jedna na milion, piękność, której *umysł* jest równie niebezpieczny co *krągłości*. Skrywa jednak pewną *tajemnicę*.
links.belarusian: І гэта не якая-небудзь — гэта жанчына адна на мільён, прыгажуння, чый *розум* такі ж небяспечны, як і *формы*. Аднак яна хавае пэўную *таямніцу*.

links.title: You: "Man, who doesn't?"
links.english: Man, who doesn't?
links.polish: A kto nie skrywa?
links.belarusian: А хто не скрывае?

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Secrets are the currency of human r..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: Secrets are the currency of human relations.
links.polish: Tajemnice są walutą stosunków międzyludzkich.
links.belarusian: Таямніцы з'яўляюцца валютай міжасабовых адносін.

links.title: Volition: "Your secrets are unknown even unto..."
links.english: Your secrets are unknown even unto you, so does that make you a rich man or a beggar?
links.polish: Twoje tajemnice są nieznane nawet tobie. Czyni cię to bogaczem czy żebrakiem?
links.belarusian: Твае таямніцы невядомыя нават табе. Гэта робіць цябе багатым або жабраком?

links.title: You: "Sounds like my kind of woman."
links.english: Sounds like my kind of woman.
links.polish: To chyba kobieta w sam raz dla mnie.
links.belarusian: Гэта, напэўна, жанчына, якая менавіта для мяне.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "She's any man's kind of woman, acco..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: She's any man's kind of woman, according to this book.
links.polish: To kobieta w sam raz dla każdego faceta, jeśli wierzyć tej książce.
links.belarusian: Гэта жанчына якраз для кожнага мужчыны, калі верыць гэтай кнізе.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Are you s-s-sure about that? Someth..."
links.english: Are you s-s-sure about that? Something about her gives you a *bad* feeling. What kind of *secret* is she hiding?
links.polish: J-j-jesteś tego pewien? Jest w niej coś, co budzi twoje *złe* przeczucia. Jaka jest ta *tajemnica*, którą skrywa?
links.belarusian: Ц-ц-ці ты ўпэўнены ў гэтым? У ёй ёсць нешта, што выклікае ў цябе *дрэнныя* прадчуванні. Якая гэта *тайна*, якую яна хавае?

links.title: Composure: "You couldn't handle a woman like th..."
links.english: You couldn't handle a woman like that. Look at yourself. You couldn't even handle your --
links.polish: Nie poradziłbyś sobie z taką kobietą. Spójrz tylko na siebie. Nie radziłeś sobie nawet z...
links.belarusian: Ты не справіўся б з такой жанчынай. Паглядзі толькі на сябе. Ты ж не спраўляўся нават з...

links.title: Inland Empire: "STOP. Don't say it!"
links.english: STOP. Don't say it!
links.polish: PRZESTAŃ. Nie mów tego!
links.belarusian: СПЫНІСЯ. Не кажы гэтага!

links.title: You: "Don't say what?"
links.english: Don't say what?
links.polish: Ale czego?
links.belarusian: Але чаго?

links.title: Composure: "Nothing. Forget it. Go back to your..."
links.english: Nothing. Forget it. Go back to your story.
links.polish: Niczego. Nieważne. Wracaj do fabuły.
links.belarusian: Нічога. Не важна. Вяртайся да сюжэту.

links.title: You: "Now it's getting interesting. (Keep..."
links.english: Now it's getting interesting. (Keep reading.)
links.polish: Robi się ciekawie. (Czytaj dalej).
links.belarusian: Становіцца цікава. (Чытай далей).

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Deneuve reveals that she was Spilla..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: Deneuve reveals that she was Spillane's lover, and that he was mixed up with a local amphetamine smuggling operation. As soon as Mullen begins pulling at strings, the whole conspiracy begins to unravel...
links.polish: Deneuve zdradza, że była kochanką Spillane'a i że był on zamieszany w miejscową operację przemytu amfetaminy. Kiedy tylko Mullen pociąga mocniej za ten skrawek informacji, zaczyna się odsłaniać mechanizm całego spisku...
links.belarusian: Данёў распавядае, што была каханкай Спілэйн і што ён быў замешаны ў мясцовую аперацыю кантрабанды амфетаміну. Як толькі Мален пачынае больш уважліва даследаваць гэты ўрывак інфармацыі, пачынае раскрывацца механізм усяго змовы...

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Not only is the local police captai..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: Not only is the local police captain in on the amphetamine ring, so is the son of a powerful politician, and a strung-out art collector named Torvald. Each of whom has his own reasons for wanting Spillane dead...
links.polish: Do amfetaminowego gangu należy nie tylko miejscowy kapitan policji, ale też syn wpływowego polityka i pewien kolekcjoner sztuki na narkotykowym głodzie – Torvald. Każdy z nich ma swoje powody, aby pragnąć śmierci Spillane'a...
links.belarusian: Да амфетамінавай банды належаць не толькі мясцовы капітан паліцыі, але і сын уплывовага палітыка і пэўны калекцыянер мастацтва на наркатычным голадзе – Торвальд. Кожны з іх мае свае прычыны, каб жадаць смерці Спілэйн...

links.title: You: "Tell me about the corrupt police ca..."
links.english: Tell me about the corrupt police captain.
links.polish: Opowiedz mi o skorumpowanym kapitanie.
links.belarusian: Раскажы мне пра карумпаванага капітана.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Outwardly, the old police captain i..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: Outwardly, the old police captain is a real law-and-order crypto-fascist, a barrel-chested man who's beaten his share of suspects to pulp. But he's also dirty, and increasingly paranoid that someone's going to expose his role in the drug ring...
links.polish: Stary kapitan policji roztacza wokół siebie aurę przywiązanego do prawa i porządku kryptofaszysty, potężnego mężczyzny, który niejednego podejrzanego sprał na krwisty befsztyk. Jest też jednak skorumpowany i coraz bardziej ogarnięty paranoją, że ktoś ujawni jego rolę w narkotykowym gangu...
links.belarusian: Стары капітан міліцыі распаўсюджвае вакол сябе аўру прыхільніка закону і парадку криптафашиста, магутнага мужчыны, які не аднаго падазраванага перабіў у крывавы стейк. Але ён таксама карумпаваны і ўсё больш ахоплены паранояй, што нехта раскрые яго ролю ў наркатычным бандыцкім групаванні...

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "He would certainly have the motive..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: He would certainly have the motive and the means, but the captain walks with a noticeable *limp* from an old war injury. Is it possible he was able to conceal it long enough to commit the murder?
links.polish: Kapitan na pewno ma i motyw, i środki niezbędne do dokonania morderstwa, lecz wyraźnie *utyka* wskutek odniesionej na wojnie rany. Czy to możliwe, aby zamaskował tę wadę na czas wystarczający do popełnienia morderstwa?
links.belarusian: Капітан напэўна мае і матыў, і сродкі, неабходныя для здзяйснення забойства, але відавочна *кульгае* з прычыны раны, атрыманай на вайне. Ці магчыма, каб ён замаскіраваў гэты недахоп на час, дастатковы для ўчынення забойства?

links.title: You: "I want to hear about the politician..."
links.english: I want to hear about the politician's son.
links.polish: Chcę posłuchać o synu polityka.
links.belarusian: Я хачу паслухаць пра сына палітыка.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "A typical privileged twat. In all l..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: A typical privileged twat. In all likelihood, he's just in over his head. He does bear a personal grudge against Spillane though, a former prosecutor who nearly brought down his father's administration...
links.polish: Typowy dupek, któremu zbyt wiele wolno. Najprawdopodobniej po prostu wpakował się bezmyślnie w bagno. Żywił jednak do Spillane'a osobistą urazę – zdołał kiedyś nieomal doprowadzić jako śledczy do upadku administracji jego ojca.
links.belarusian: Тыповы нахабнік, якому занадта шмат дазволена. Найхутчэй проста бездумна ўвязаўся ў калатнечу. Аднак меў асабістую крыўду да Спілейна – калісьці амаль здолеў прывесці да падзення адміністрацыю яго бацькі, працуючы следчым.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "The kid doesn't exactly have Dick M..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: The kid doesn't exactly have Dick Mullen's manly build, but he is the correct height, and while interrogating him at his home, Mullen *did* notice a certain overcoat that looks suspiciously like his own...
links.polish: Gnojek nie ma raczej potężnej budowy, jaka cechuje Dicka Mullena, odpowiada mu jednak wzrostem, a kiedy detektyw przesłuchiwał go w jego domu, zauważył pewien płaszcz *podejrzanie* podobny do jego własnego...
links.belarusian: Гнойак не мае такой магутнай будовы, якая характарызуе Дзіка Мулена, аднак суадносіцца з ім па росце, а калі дэтэктыў дапытваў яго ў яго доме, заўважыў пэўны плашч *падазрона* падобны да свайго ўласнага...

links.title: You: "What was that about an art collecto..."
links.english: What was that about an art collector?
links.polish: Co to za kolekcjoner sztuki?
links.belarusian: Што гэта за калекцыянер мастацтва?

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Torvald the Art Collector is a stru..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: Torvald the Art Collector is a strung-out mess. Frankly, it's hard to imagine him holding a pistol steady enough to actually hit someone, let alone plug them three times in the chest the way old Spillane got did...
links.polish: Kolekcjoner sztuki Torvald to nękany narkotykowym głodem kłębek nieszczęścia. Szczerze mówiąc, nie sposób sobie wyobrazić, że mógłby on utrzymać pistolet na tyle nieruchomo, by kogoś faktycznie trafić, nie mówiąc już o trzykrotnym strzale w klatkę piersiową, jak to zrobiono ze Spillane'em...
links.belarusian: Калекцыянер мастацтва Торвальд – гэта замучаны наркатычным голадам камяк няшчасця. Шчыра кажучы, немагчыма ўявіць, што ён мог бы трымаць пісталет настолькі нерухома, каб кагосьці сапраўды трапіць, не кажучы ўжо пра тройны стрэл у грудзі, як гэта зрабілі са Спіллэнам...

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "That said, Torvald and Spillane hav..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: That said, Torvald and Spillane have a long history, and while interrogating him, Mullen discovers that Torvald was once *involved* with Deanna Deneuve. Could it be that this is all over a sordid *love triangle*?
links.polish: Z drugiej strony Torvald i Spillane mieli ze sobą mocno na pieńku, a ponadto Mullen odkrył podczas przesłuchania, że kolekcjoner był niegdyś *związany* z Deanną Deneuve. Czy zarzewiem tragedii mógł być ten ponury *miłosny trójkąt*?
links.belarusian: З другога боку, Торвальд і Спілейн мелі моцныя непрыемнасці, а акрамя таго, Мулен выявіў падчас допыту, што калекцыянер калісьці быў *звязаны* з Дэанай Дэнёў. Ці магла быць крыніцай трагедыі гэтая змрочная *любоўная трохвугольнік*?

links.title: You: "Okay, let's get on with the story."
links.english: Okay, let's get on with the story.
links.polish: Dobra, ruszajmy dalej z fabułą.
links.belarusian: Добра, рушым далей з сюжэтам.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "One evening, Deanna Deneuve comes t..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: One evening, Deanna Deneuve comes to Mullen's hostel room in tears. The two of them drink half a bottle of vodka, and soon they're seeking comfort in each other's arms...
links.polish: Pewnego wieczora Deanna Deneuve przychodzi do pokoju hostelowego Mullena cała zapłakana. Wypijają we dwójkę pół butelki wódki i wkrótce padają sobie w miłosne objęcia, szukając pocieszenia...
links.belarusian: Аднаго вечара Дэана Дэноў прыходзіць у пакой у хостэле да Мулена ўся ў слязах. Яны ўдвох выпіваюць паўбутэлькі гарэлкі і хутка апынаюцца ў абдымках, шукаючы суцяшэння...

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Yes, comfort and pleasure. The warm..."
links.english: Yes, comfort and pleasure. The warmth of another human's touch, the burning taste of liquor on her full, sweet lips...
links.polish: Tak, pocieszenia i przyjemności. Ciepła dotyku drugiej osoby, palącego smaku trunku na jej pełnych, słodkich ustach...
links.belarusian: Так, суцяшэнні і прыемнасці. Цяпло дотыку другой асобы, палкае адчуванне напою на яе поўных, салодкіх вуснах...

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Well, *that* testimony won't be adm..."
links.english: Well, *that* testimony won't be admissible any longer.
links.polish: No, *to* zeznanie nie będzie już wiarygodne.
links.belarusian: Не, *тае* сведчанне ўжо не будзе надзейным.

links.title: You: "How does Mullen expect to solve the..."
links.english: How does Mullen expect to solve the murder if he's sleeping with witnesses!
links.polish: Jak ten Mullen chce rozwiązać sprawę morderstwa, jeśli sypia ze świadkami?
links.belarusian: Як гэты Маллен хоча вырашыць справу забойства, калі спіць са сведкамі?

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "The man's a prosecutor's nightmare...."
links.english: The man's a prosecutor's nightmare. Solving a murder counts for nothing if all the evidence gets thrown out in court over police misconduct.
links.polish: Ten człowiek to koszmar prokuratora. Rozwiązanie sprawy morderstwa nic nie znaczy, jeśli sąd odrzuca wszelkie dowody z powodu zaniedbań policji.
links.belarusian: Гэты чалавек - кашмар пракурора. Вырашэнне справы аб забойстве нічога не азначае, калі суд адхіляе ўсе доказы з-за халатнасці паліцыі.

links.title: Authority: "That's just Dick Mullen's *modus op..."
links.english: That's just Dick Mullen's *modus operandi*. He might bend the rules, but he closes cases no one else can.
links.polish: To po prostu *modus operandi* Dicka Mullena. Może i nagina zasady, ale za to rozwiązuje też sprawy, na których inni łamią zęby.
links.belarusian: Гэта проста *modus operandi* Дзіка Мулена. Можа, ён і згінае правілы, але затое вырашае справы, на якіх іншыя ламаюць зубы.

links.title: You: "Nice. Get it, Mullen."
links.english: Nice. Get it, Mullen.
links.polish: Nieźle. Dobra jest, Mullen.
links.belarusian: Нядрэнна. Добра ёсць, Мулен.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "As the two lovers share a post-coit..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: As the two lovers share a post-coital cigarette, Deanna Deneuve turns to Mullen and says, "By the way, Dick, there was something else I meant to tell you..."
links.polish: Kiedy kochankowie zapalają po odbyciu stosunku papierosa, Deanna Deneuve odwraca się do Mullena i mówi: „A swoją drogą, Dick, chciałam powiedzieć ci coś jeszcze...”.
links.belarusian: Калі палюбоўнікі запальваюць цыгарэту пасля палавога акту, Дэанна Дэнёў паварочваецца да Малена і кажа: "Дарэчы, Дык, я хацела сказаць табе яшчэ нешта...".

links.title: Inland Empire: ""I love you"?"
links.english: "I love you"?
links.polish: „Kocham cię”?
links.belarusian: "Кахаю цябе"?

links.title: Half Light: "The name of the true killer?"
links.english: The name of the true killer?
links.polish: Imię prawdziwego zabójcy?
links.belarusian: Імя сапраўднага забойцы?

links.title: Hand/Eye Coordination: ""Always aim for the centre of mass"..."
links.english: "Always aim for the centre of mass"?
links.polish: „Zawsze celuj w środek ciała ofiary?”
links.belarusian: "Заўсёды цэлься ў сярэдзіну цела ахвяры?"

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Whatever it is, Mullen never hears..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: Whatever it is, Mullen never hears the words -- A blow to the base of his skull knocks him out cold instantly.
links.polish: Cokolwiek to jest, Mullen tego nie słyszy – uderzenie w potylicę pozbawia go natychmiast przytomności.
links.belarusian: Што б гэта ні было, Мален гэтага не чуе – удар па патыліцы адразу пазбаўляе яго прытомнасці.

links.title: You: "Fuck."
links.english: Fuck.
links.polish: O kurwa.
links.belarusian: О чорт.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "When Mullen comes to, Deneuve is de..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: When Mullen comes to, Deneuve is dead on the hostel bed next to him. To make matters worse, his clothes are covered with her blood!
links.polish: Kiedy Mullen dochodzi do siebie, Deneuve leży obok niego na hostelowym, martwa. Co gorsza, jego ubrania są poplamione jej krwią!
links.belarusian: Калі Мален прыходзіць у сябе, Дэнёў ляжыць побач з ім на ложку ў хостэле, мёртвая. Што яшчэ горш, яго адзенне запэцканае яе крывёю!

links.title: You: "Double fuck!"
links.english: Double fuck!
links.polish: O skurwiona kurwa!

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Mullen trashes his blood-stained cl..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: Mullen trashes his blood-stained clothes and flees the hostel, knowing it's only a matter of hours before the cops discover Deneuve's body, if they haven't been tipped off already...
links.polish: Mullen pozbywa się splamionych krwią ubrań i ucieka z hostelu, wiedząc, że za ledwie kilka godzin policja odkryje ciało Deneuve, o ile nie została już powiadomiona...
links.belarusian: Мален пазбаўляецца ад запэцканай крывёй адзежы і ўцякае з хостэла, ведаючы, што праз некалькі гадзін паліцыя знойдзе цела Дэноў, калі яе ўжо не паведамілі...

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Fleeing a crime scene, destroying e..."
links.english: Fleeing a crime scene, destroying evidence... Even if Detective Mullen *didn't* commit the murder, he should be facing *years* behind bars.
links.polish: Ucieczka z miejsca zbrodni, niszczenie dowodów... Nawet jeśli detektyw Mullen *nie popełnił* tego morderstwa, powinien trafić za kraty na całe *lata*.
links.belarusian: Уцёкі з месца злачынства, знішчэнне доказаў... Нават калі дэтэктыў Мален *не здзейсніў* гэтае забойства, ён павінен трапіць за краты на цэлыя *гады*.

links.title: Authority: "Dick Mullen won't be sent to the cl..."
links.english: Dick Mullen won't be sent to the clink for the sake of some *legal niceties*!
links.polish: Dick Mullen nie pójdzie do paki z powodu jakichś prawnych szczególików!
links.belarusian: Дык Мулен не трапіць за краты з-за нейкіх прававых дэталяў!

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "The heat is on! If Dick Mullen can'..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: The heat is on! If Dick Mullen can't solve both murders before the cops catch up to him, he's going away for life...
links.polish: Robi się gorąco! Jeśli Dick Mullen nie rozwiąże zagadki obu morderstw, zanim dopadnie go policja, trafi na całe życie za kraty...
links.belarusian: Становіцца горача! Калі Дзік Маллен не раскрые загадку абодвух забойстваў, перш чым яго зловіць паліцыя, ён трапіць на ўсё жыццё за краты...

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "And you'll never know what happens!..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: And you'll never know what happens! Because the rest of the book is gone.
links.polish: I nigdy nie dowiesz się, co się stało. Bo reszta książki przepadła.
links.belarusian: І ніколі не даведаешся, што здарылася. Бо астатняя частка кнігі знікла.

links.title: You: "I can surmise, can't I? If Mullen g..."
links.english: I can surmise, can't I? If Mullen goes to jail there wouldn't be like fifty more of these books.
links.polish: Ale mogę przyjąć jakieś założenie, nieprawdaż? Gdyby Mullen poszedł do więzienia, nie powstałoby jeszcze pięćdziesiąt czy ile tam kolejnych książek z serii.
links.belarusian: Але я магу прыняць нейкае дапушчэнне, праўда? Калі б Мулен пайшоў у турму, не з'явілася б яшчэ пяцьдзесят ці колькі там наступных кніг з серыі.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "What makes you think this isn't *th..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: What makes you think this isn't *the final Dick Mullen case*?
links.polish: A skąd wniosek, że to nie jest *ostatnia sprawa Dicka Mullena*?
links.belarusian: А адкуль выснова, што гэта не *апошняя справа Дзіка Малена*?

links.title: You: "Isn't there already a book called "..."
links.english: Isn't there already a book called "Dick Mullen and the Final Case" or something?
links.polish: A nie ma już przypadkiem książki pod tytułem „Dick Mullen i ostatnia sprawa” czy jakoś tak?
links.belarusian: Ці няма часам кнігі пад назвай "Дзiк Маллен i апошняя справа" цi нешта такое?

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "How do you know this isn't the *fin..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: How do you know this isn't the *final* final case?
links.polish: Ale skąd wiesz, że to nie *ostatnia* ostatnia sprawa?
links.belarusian: Але адкуль ты ведаеш, што гэта не *апошняя* апошняя справа?

links.title: Logic: "This could go on forever. End it no..."
links.english: This could go on forever. End it now.
links.polish: Tak można bez końca. Ukróć to. Już.
links.belarusian: Так можна бясконца. Скараці гэта. Жыдка.

links.title: You: "Okay, whatever, this is getting rid..."
links.english: Okay, whatever, this is getting ridiculous. (Close the book.)
links.polish: Dobra, nieważne, to się robi absurdalne. (Zamknij książkę).
links.belarusian: Добра, неважна, гэта становіцца абсурдным. (Закрый кнігу).

links.title: You: "Guess that's it, then. (Close the b..."
links.english: Guess that's it, then. (Close the book.)
links.polish: To by chyba było w takim razie na tyle. (Zamknij książkę).
links.belarusian: Гэта, відаць, было б усё. (Закрый кнігу).

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Can you solve the case before the c..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: Can you solve the case before the cops close in?
links.polish: Czy zdołasz rozwiązać tę sprawę, zanim dopadnie cię policja?
links.belarusian: Ці здолееш ты вырашыць гэтую справу, перш чым цябе зловіць міліцыя?

links.title: You: "Wait -- I've got some questions fir..."
links.english: Wait -- I've got some questions first.
links.polish: Chwila. Mam przedtem kilka pytań.
links.belarusian: Хвіліну. У мяне ёсць некалькі пытанняў.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "What is it, detective?"
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: What is it, detective?
links.polish: O co chodzi, detektywie?
links.belarusian: Што здарылася, дэтэктыў?

links.title: You: "Why does everyone close to Dick Mul..."
links.english: Why does everyone close to Dick Mullen wind up dead?
links.polish: Czemu wszyscy bliscy Dickowi Mullenowi ludzie kończą jako trupy?
links.belarusian: Чаму ўсе блізкія Дзіку Мулену людзі заканчваюць як трупы?

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "It's a dangerous line of work, but..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: It's a dangerous line of work, but somebody has to do it. That's why Dick Mullen never lets anyone get *too* close...
links.polish: To niebezpieczna robota, ale ktoś ją musi wykonywać. Dlatego właśnie Dick Mullen nigdy nie wiąże się z nikim *zbyt* mocno...
links.belarusian: Гэта небяспечная праца, але нехта павінен яе выконваць. Таму Дык Мулен ніколі не звязваецца з кімсьці *занадта* моцна...

links.title: Half Light: "What's the matter? Afraid you've be..."
links.english: What's the matter? Afraid you've been hacking up your friends' bodies in the night?
links.polish: O co chodzi? Boisz się, że nocami ćwiartujesz ciała swoich przyjaciół?
links.belarusian: Пра што ідзе гаворка? Баязлівасць, што ноччу рассякаеш целы сваіх сяброў?

links.title: Inland Empire: "You *are* the murderer, after all....."
links.english: You *are* the murderer, after all...
links.polish: W końcu *jesteś* mordercą...
links.belarusian: Урэшце *ты* забойца...

links.title: Inland Empire: "Have you gone over everyone? Is any..."
links.english: Have you gone over everyone? Is anybody missing?
links.polish: Pomyślałeś o wszystkich? Nie zaginął któryś?
links.belarusian: Ты падумаў пра ўсіх? Ніхто не прападаў?

links.title: You: "Why did Dick Mullen become a detect..."
links.english: Why did Dick Mullen become a detective in the first place?
links.polish: Czemu Dick Mullen w ogóle został detektywem?
links.belarusian: Чаму Дык Мулен увогуле стаў дэтэктывам?

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "There was never a time when he wasn..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: There was never a time when he wasn't a detective. He was born a detective.
links.polish: Nie było nigdy czasu, w którym nie był detektywem. Urodził się nim.
links.belarusian: Ніколі не было часу, калі б ён не быў дэтэктывам. Ён нарадзіўся ім.

links.title: You: "Was I *not* born to be a detective?"
links.english: Was I *not* born to be a detective?
links.polish: A ja *nie* urodziłem się detektywem?
links.belarusian: А я *не* нарадзіўся дэтэктывам?

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "For a moment, you cease to read the..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: For a moment, you cease to read the story on the page and see the book for what it is, a collection of brittle, cheaply printed pages, held together by glue made from the hooves of horses...
links.polish: Przestajesz na chwilę śledzić fabułę i dostrzegasz książkę taką, jaka ona jest – zlepkiem kruchych, zadrukowanych tanim kosztem stronic połączonych klejem z końskich kopyt...
links.belarusian: Вы на хвіліну перастаеце сачыць за сюжэтам і заўважаеце кнігу такую, якой яна ёсць — зліпак крохкіх, надрукаваных танным коштам старонак, злучаных клеем з конскіх капытоў...

links.title: Physical Instrument: "From nowhere, you hear the screech..."
links.english: From nowhere, you hear the screech of sneakers on a waxed floor, and you feel the burn of rope against your hands. Are these figments of some other life?
links.polish: Znienacka słyszysz niedobiegający znikąd pisk trampek na wypastowanej podłodze. Czujesz palącą twoją skórę na dłoniach linę. Czy to jakieś przebłyski innego życia?
links.belarusian: Раптам чуеш недзе ніадкуль писк красовак па начышчанай падлозе. Адчуваеш, як палатка твае скуры на далонях вяроўка. Ці гэта нейкія ўспышкі іншага жыцця?

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "You won't find the answers you're l..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: You won't find the answers you're looking for here, in other words.
links.polish: Innymi słowy nie znajdziesz tu odpowiedzi, których potrzebujesz.
links.belarusian: Іншымі словамі, тут ты не знойдзеш адказаў, якія табе патрэбныя.

links.title: You: "But why is he like that?"
links.english: But why is he like that?
links.polish: Ale czemu on taki jest?
links.belarusian: Але чаму ён такі ёсць?

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Dick Mullen was made to crack skull..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: Dick Mullen was made to crack skulls and solve cases. It's who he is. He could no more stop being a detective than a tiger could cease to be a predator in the night.
links.polish: Dick Mullen urodził się, aby rozbijać głowy i rozwiązywać sprawy. Taki po prostu jest. Nie mógł przestać być detektywem, tak jak tygrys nie może przestać być nocnym łowcą.
links.belarusian: Дык Маллен нарадзіўся, каб ламаць галовы і раскрываць справы. Такі ён проста ёсць. Ён не мог перастаць быць дэтэктывам, як тыгр не можа перастаць быць начным паляўнічым.

links.title: Volition: "You're no tiger, though, Harry. You..."
links.english: You're no tiger, though, Harry. You're a man. It's your curse to have to choose.
links.polish: Ale ty nie jesteś tygrysem, Harry. Jesteś człowiekiem. Konieczność podejmowania wyborów to twoja klątwa.
links.belarusian: Але ты не тыгр, Гары. Ты чалавек. Неабходнасць рабіць выбар — гэта тваё пракляцце.

links.title: Volition: "You're no tiger, though, detective...."
links.english: You're no tiger, though, detective. You're a man. It's your curse to have to choose.
links.polish: Ale ty nie jesteś tygrysem, detektywie. Jesteś człowiekiem. Konieczność podejmowania wyborów to twoja klątwa.
links.belarusian: Але ты не тыгр, дэтэктыве. Ты чалавек. Неабходнасць прымаць выбары – гэта твое праклён.

links.title: You: "Why bother solving crimes when the..."
links.english: Why bother solving crimes when the world is so evil?
links.polish: Po co w ogóle rozwiązywać śledztwa, kiedy cały świat jest tak podły?
links.belarusian: Навошта ўвогуле расследаваць справы, калі ўвесь свет такі падлы?

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Is it really so evil, detective?"
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: Is it really so evil, detective?
links.polish: Czy aby na pewno jest aż tak podły, detektywie?
links.belarusian: Ці сапраўды ён такі падлы, дэтэктыў?

links.title: You: "Okay, maybe not. There are parts wo..."
links.english: Okay, maybe not. There are parts worth saving.
links.polish: No dobra, może nie. Niektóre części warto uratować.
links.belarusian: Ну добра, можа не. Некаторыя часткі варта ўратаваць.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Like what?"
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: Like what?
links.polish: Na przykład?
links.belarusian: Напрыклад?

links.title: You: "Friends and family."
links.english: Friends and family.
links.polish: Przyjaciół i rodzinę.
links.belarusian: Сяброў і сям'ю.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Do you even *have* those?"
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: Do you even *have* those?
links.polish: A ty ich w ogóle *masz*?
links.belarusian: А ты іх увогуле *маеш*?

links.title: You: "I've got Kim."
links.english: I've got Kim.
links.polish: Mam Kima.
links.belarusian: У мяне ёсць Кім.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Just make sure you don't lose him...."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: Just make sure you don't lose him. You'll not find another like him...
links.polish: Tylko zadbaj o to, żeby go nie stracisz. Nie znajdziesz więcej kogoś takiego...
links.belarusian: Толькі паклапаціся пра тое, каб яго не страціць. Ты больш не знойдзеш такога чалавека...

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "It's true in more ways than you kno..."
links.english: It's true in more ways than you know.
links.polish: To prawda. Na więcej sposobów, niż ci się wydaje.
links.belarusian: Гэта праўда. Больш спосабаў, чым ты думаеш.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "You haven't been treating the lieut..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: You haven't been treating the lieutenant much like a friend, though, have you?
links.polish: Ale nie traktujesz porucznika za bardzo jak przyjaciela, nieprawdaż?
links.belarusian: Але ж вы не ставіцеся да лейтэнанта занадта як да сябра, праўда?

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "You haven't. But it's not too late...."
links.english: You haven't. But it's not too late. You share a bond that's thicker than blood.
links.polish: Nie traktujesz. Ale jeszcze nie jest za późno. Łączy was więź mocniejsza od krwi.
links.belarusian: Ты не ставішся. Але яшчэ не позна. Вас злучае сувязь мацнейшая за кроў.

links.title: You: "I might. I just need to find them."
links.english: I might. I just need to find them.
links.polish: Może mam. Muszę ich tylko znaleźć.
links.belarusian: Можа, у мяне ёсць. Мне трэба іх толькі знайсці.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Yes, yes. They're out there waiting..."
links.english: Yes, yes. They're out there waiting for you, just over the next rise, up on Marvel Hill!
links.polish: Tak, tak. Czekają gdzieś tam na ciebie. Zaraz za następnym zakrętem. Tam, na Cudownej Górze!
links.belarusian: Так, так. Чакаюць недзе там на цябе. Адразу за наступным паваротам. Там, на Цудоўнай Гары!

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Did you lose them? Or did they leav..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: Did you lose them? Or did they leave you? Do you even know the difference?
links.polish: Straciłeś ich? A może cię zostawili? Wiesz w ogóle, jaka jest różnica?
links.belarusian: Ці ты іх страціў? А можа, яны цябе пакінулі? Ці ведаеш ты наогул, якая розніца?

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "But then what does this book know?..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: But then what does this book know? It's just a poorly made piece of pulp garbage, made to be consumed and discarded.
links.polish: Ale co ta książka może wiedzieć? To tylko tandetnie sklecony literacki śmieć przeznaczony do skonsumowania i wyrzucenia.
links.belarusian: Але што гэтая кніга можа ведаць? Гэта толькі танна зляпсаваны літаратурны смецце, прызначанае для спажывання і выкідвання.

links.title: You: "I did, but I lost them."
links.english: I did, but I lost them.
links.polish: Miałem, ale ich straciłem.
links.belarusian: Я меў, але страціў іх.

links.title: You: "The pleasure of contemplating art!"
links.english: The pleasure of contemplating art!
links.polish: Przyjemność z kontemplacji sztuki!
links.belarusian: Задавальненне ад сузірання мастацтва!

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "You don't know how you know, but yo..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: You don't know how you know, but you can feel this book *laughing* at you.
links.polish: Nie wiesz, skąd to wiesz, ale czujesz, że ta książka się z ciebie *naśmiewa*.
links.belarusian: Вы не ведаеце, адкуль гэта ведаеце, але адчуваеце, што гэтая кніга *смяецца* з вас.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "*Art*? You think contemplating *art..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: *Art*? You think contemplating *art* is going to save you?
links.polish: *Sztuki*? Myślisz, że kontemplacja *sztuki* cię uratuje?
links.belarusian: *Мастацтва*? Ты думаеш, што сузіранне *мастацтва* цябе выратуе?

links.title: You: "Yeah, I do. I'm the god damn art co..."
links.english: Yeah, I do. I'm the god damn art cop, after all.
links.polish: Tak, tak myślę. W końcu jestem cholernym artystycznym gliną.
links.belarusian: Так, так я думаю. У рэшце рэшт, я кляты мастацкі мянцік.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Whatever you say, *art cop*. The bo..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: Whatever you say, *art cop*. The book has stopped laughing, but you can feel it grinning smugly at you.
links.polish: Pogadaj sobie, *artystyczny glino*. Książka przestała się śmiać, ale czujesz, że wciąż się szyderczo uśmiecha.
links.belarusian: Пагавары сабе, *мастацкі паліцэйскі*. Кніга перастала смяяцца, але ты адчуваеш, што яна ўсё яшчэ іранічна ўсміхаецца.

links.title: You: "Hey, fuck you book! (Give the book..."
links.english: Hey, fuck you book! (Give the book the finger.)
links.polish: Ej, pierdol się, książko! (Pokaż jej środkowy palec).
links.belarusian: Эй, пайшоў ты, кніга! (Пакажы ёй сярэдні палец).

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "You know you look like a mad man, r..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: You know you look like a mad man, right? Giving an inanimate object the finger like that.
links.polish: Wiesz, że wyglądasz jak wariat, prawda? Pokazujesz nieożywionemu przedmiotowi środkowy palec.
links.belarusian: Ты ведаеш, што выглядаеш як вар’ят, праўда? Паказваеш неажыўленаму прадмету сярэдні палец.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What's the matter, detective?""
links.english: "What's the matter, detective?"
links.polish: „Co się stało, detektywie?”
links.belarusian: "Што здарылася, дэтэктыве?"

links.title: You: ""This book is making fun of my sinc..."
links.english: "This book is making fun of my sincerest beliefs."
links.polish: „Ta książka naśmiewa się z moich najszczerszych przekonań”.
links.belarusian: "Гэтая кніга здзекуецца з маіх самых шчырых перакананняў".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Then perhaps you should stop readi..."
links.english: "Then perhaps you should stop reading it."
links.polish: „W takim razie być może powinieneś przestać ją czytać”.
links.belarusian: "Тады, магчыма, табе варта перастаць яе чытаць".

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "But you can't stop, can you? You've..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: But you can't stop, can you? You've got to find out what happens.
links.polish: Ale nie możesz przestać, prawda? Musisz się dowiedzieć, co było dalej.
links.belarusian: Але ты не можаш спыніцца, праўда? Табе трэба даведацца, што было далей.

links.title: You: "The sweet taste of a good cigarette..."
links.english: The sweet taste of a good cigarette, which I still need to find.
links.polish: Słodki smak dobrego papierosa, którego wciąż nie mam i muszę znaleźć.
links.belarusian: Салодкі смак добрага цыгарэты, якой у мяне ўсё яшчэ няма і якую мушу знайсці.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "There are worse things in the world..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: There are worse things in the world than the pursuit of chemical pleasures. But there are better things, too...
links.polish: Są na świecie gorsze rzeczy niż pościg za chemicznymi przyjemnościami. Ale są i lepsze...
links.belarusian: Ёсць у свеце рэчы горшыя, чым пагоня за хімічнымі асалодамі. Але ёсць і лепшыя...

links.title: Electrochemistry: "What's a *book* know about real ple..."
links.english: What's a *book* know about real pleasure? What's better than feeling your mesolimbic pathway flood your mind-crevices with *pure* dopamine?
links.polish: A co *książka* może wiedzieć o prawdziwej przyjemności? Co jest lepsze niż zalewający twój umysł *czystą* dopaminą mezolimbiczny szlak dopaminergiczny?
links.belarusian: А што *кніга* можа ведаць пра сапраўднае задавальненне? Што лепш за мезалімічны дофамінавы шлях, які залівае твой розум *чыстай* дофамінай?

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Why are you even still reading this..."
links.english: Why are you even still reading this garbage? You've got smokes to find!
links.polish: Po co ty jeszcze czytasz tego śmiecia? Musisz znaleźć fajki!
links.belarusian: Навошта ты яшчэ чытаеш гэты смецце? Табе трэба знайсці цыгарэты!

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Why are you even still reading this..."
links.english: Why are you even still reading this garbage? Rip some sweet cigs instead!
links.polish: Po co ty jeszcze czytasz tego śmiecia? Zapal lepiej pysznego fajeczka!
links.belarusian: Навошта ты ўсё яшчэ чытаеш гэты бруд? Лепш запалі смачную трубачку!

links.title: You: "The taste of a good cigarette."
links.english: The taste of a good cigarette.
links.polish: Smak dobrego papierosa.
links.belarusian: Смак добрага цыгарэты.

links.title: You: "The smooth taste of some ultra-high..."
links.english: The smooth taste of some ultra-high-proof booze.
links.polish: Wykwintny smak najlepszej klasy alkoholi.
links.belarusian: Вытанчаны смак лепшых класаў алкаголю.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "There are worse things in the world..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: There are worse things in the world than the pursuit of chemical pleasures. But there are better things, too...
links.polish: Są na świecie gorsze rzeczy niż pościg za chemicznymi przyjemnościami. Ale są i lepsze...
links.belarusian: Ёсць у свеце горшыя рэчы, чым пагоня за хімічнымі асалодамі. Але ёсць і лепшыя...

links.title: Electrochemistry: "What's a *book* know about real ple..."
links.english: What's a *book* know about real pleasure? What's better than feeling your mesolimbic pathway flood your mind-crevices with *pure* dopamine?
links.polish: A co *książka* może wiedzieć o prawdziwej przyjemności? Co jest lepsze niż zalewający twój umysł *czystą* dopaminą mezolimbiczny szlak dopaminergiczny?
links.belarusian: А што кніга можа ведаць пра сапраўднае задавальненне? Што можа быць лепшым за мезолімбічны шлях дафтиаміна, які напаўняе твой розум чыстай дафаміновай залевамі?

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Why are you even still reading this..."
links.english: Why are you even still reading this garbage? Heed the bottle's call.
links.polish: Po co ty jeszcze czytasz tego śmiecia? Wzywa cię do siebie butelka.
links.belarusian: Навошта ты яшчэ чытаеш гэты смецце? Цябе кліча да сябе бутэлька.

links.title: You: "Drugs. You know it's all about the..."
links.english: Drugs. You know it's all about the drugs.
links.polish: Narkotyki. Wiesz, że w życiu chodzi o narkotyki.
links.belarusian: Наркотыкі. Ведаеш, што ў жыцці гаворка ідзе пра наркотыкі.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "There are worse things in the world..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: There are worse things in the world than the pursuit of chemical pleasures. But there are better things, too...
links.polish: Są na świecie gorsze rzeczy niż pościg za chemicznymi przyjemnościami. Ale są i lepsze...
links.belarusian: Ёсць на свеце горшыя рэчы, чым пагоня за хімічнымі асалодамі. Але ёсць і лепшыя...

links.title: Electrochemistry: "What's a *book* know about real ple..."
links.english: What's a *book* know about real pleasure? What's better than feeling your mesolimbic pathway flood your mind-crevices with *pure* dopamine?
links.polish: A co *książka* może wiedzieć o prawdziwej przyjemności? Co jest lepsze niż zalewający twój umysł *czystą* dopaminą mezolimbiczny szlak dopaminergiczny?
links.belarusian: А што *кніга* можа ведаць пра сапраўднае задавальненне? Што можа быць лепш, чым заліваючы твой розум *чысцейшай* дофамінам мезаліmbічны дофамінергічны шлях?

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Why are you even still reading this..."
links.english: Why are you even still reading this garbage? Baby, get some of that sweet speed or spooky pyrholidon... it's the good stuff.
links.polish: Po co ty jeszcze czytasz tego śmiecia? Słoneczko, strzel sobie trochę pysznego speedu albo srogiego pyrholidonu... To najlepszy towar.
links.belarusian: Навошта ты яшчэ чытаеш гэтае смецце? Сонейка, займіся крыху смачнага спіду ці суровага пірролідону... Гэта найлепшы тавар.

links.title: You: "Yep, it's pretty fucking evil."
links.english: Yep, it's pretty fucking evil.
links.polish: Tak, jest, kurwa, całkiem podły.
links.belarusian: Так, гэта, блін, даволі подла.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Then why are you still here?"
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: Then why are you still here?
links.polish: To czemu wciąż tu jesteś?
links.belarusian: Дык чаму ты ўсё яшчэ тут?

links.title: You: "Because I don't want to let Kim dow..."
links.english: Because I don't want to let Kim down.
links.polish: Bo nie chcę zawieść Kima.
links.belarusian: Бо не хачу падвесці Кіма.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Just make sure you don't lose him...."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: Just make sure you don't lose him. You'll not find another like him...
links.polish: Tylko zadbaj o to, żeby go nie stracisz. Nie znajdziesz więcej kogoś takiego...
links.belarusian: Проста паклапаціся пра тое, каб не страціць яго. Ты больш не знойдзеш кагосьці такога...

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "It's true in more ways than you kno..."
links.english: It's true in more ways than you know.
links.polish: To prawda. Na więcej sposobów, niż ci się wydaje.
links.belarusian: Гэта праўда. На больш спосабаў, чым ты думаеш.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "You haven't been treating the lieut..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: You haven't been treating the lieutenant much like a friend, though, have you?
links.polish: Ale nie traktujesz porucznika za bardzo jak przyjaciela, nieprawdaż?
links.belarusian: Але ж ты не ставішся да лейтэнанта занадта як да сябра, ці не так?

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "You haven't. But it's not too late...."
links.english: You haven't. But it's not too late. You share a bond that's thicker than blood.
links.polish: Nie traktujesz. Ale jeszcze nie jest za późno. Łączy was więź mocniejsza od krwi.
links.belarusian: Ты не разглядаеш. Але яшчэ не позна. Вас звязвае сувязь мацнейшая за кроў.

links.title: You: "Because I need to solve this case...."
links.english: Because I need to solve this case. Not for anyone else's sake. For me.
links.polish: Bo muszę rozwiązać tę sprawę. Dla siebie. Nie dla kogokolwiek innego.
links.belarusian: Бо я павінен вырашыць гэтую справу. Для сябе. Не для каго-небудзь іншага.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "What are you trying to prove, exact..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: What are you trying to prove, exactly? And what will change if you *do* manage to prove it?
links.polish: Co ty w właściwie próbujesz udowodnić? I co się zmieni, jeśli ci się to *uda*?
links.belarusian: Што ты ўвогуле спрабуеш даказаць? І што зменіцца, калі табе гэта *ўдасца*?

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "But then what does this book know?..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: But then what does this book know? It's just a poorly made piece of pulp garbage, made to be consumed and discarded.
links.polish: Ale co ta książka może wiedzieć? To tylko tandetnie sklecony literacki śmieć przeznaczony do skonsumowania i wyrzucenia.
links.belarusian: Але што гэтая кніга можа ведаць? Гэта толькі танна склеены літаратурны смецце, прызначаны для спажывання і выкідвання.

links.title: You: "Because I'm too chickenshit to do a..."
links.english: Because I'm too chickenshit to do anything about it.
links.polish: Bo za duży ze mnie tchórz, żeby coś z tym zrobić.
links.belarusian: Бо я занадта вялікі баязлівец, каб з гэтым нешта зрабіць.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "It sounds like you're in for a long..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: It sounds like you're in for a long, hard road, detective...
links.polish: Zdaje się, że przed tobą długa i trudna droga, detektywie...
links.belarusian: Здаецца, што перад табой доўгі і цяжкі шлях, дэтэктыў...

links.title: You: "I... don't know."
links.english: I... don't know.
links.polish: Nie wiem...
links.belarusian: Я не ведаю...

links.title: You: "Unfathomably evil. Death is infinit..."
links.english: Unfathomably evil. Death is infinitely preferable to this torment.
links.polish: Niewyobrażalnie podły. Śmierć jest o wiele lepsza od tej udręki.
links.belarusian: Неверагодна подлы. Смерць значна лепшая за гэтую пакуту.

links.title: You: "Good, evil, it makes no difference...."
links.english: Good, evil, it makes no difference. These are the end times we're living in.
links.polish: Dobry, podły – to bez znaczenia. Żyjemy w dniach ostatecznych.
links.belarusian: Добры, подлы – гэта не мае значэння. Мы жывем у апошнія дні.

links.title: You: "I don't have any more questions. I'..."
links.english: I don't have any more questions. I've figured it all out.
links.polish: Nie mam więcej pytań. Już wszystko wiem.
links.belarusian: У мяне няма больш пытанняў. Я ўжо ўсё ведаю.

links.title: You: "I've figured it out."
links.english: I've figured it out.
links.polish: Już wszystko wiem.
links.belarusian: Ужо ўсё ведаю.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "So who did it, detective? Who kille..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: So who did it, detective? Who killed Charlie Spillane and Deanna Deneuve?
links.polish: No więc kto to zrobił, detektywie? Kto zabił Charliego Spillane'a i Deanne Deneuve?
links.belarusian: Дык хто гэта зрабіў, дэтэктыве? Хто забіў Чарлі Спілэна і Дыяну Дэнаў?

links.title: You: "Communism killed them."
links.english: Communism killed them.
links.polish: Zabił ich komunizm.
links.belarusian: Яны былі забітыя камунізмам.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "What? That doesn't even make sense...."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: What? That doesn't even make sense. There's never a straight answer with you, is there? You just get hooked on random stupid notions and then repeat them every chance you get.
links.polish: Co? To nie ma żadnego sensu. Ty nie umiesz odpowiadać normalnie, co? Czepiasz się jakichś idiotycznych pomysłów i powtarzasz te swoje bzdury przy każdej okazji.
links.belarusian: Што? Гэта не мае ніякага сэнсу. Ты не ўмееш адказваць нармальна, што? Чапляешся за нейкія ідыёцкія ідэі і паўтараеш гэтыя свае глупствы пры кожнай нагодзе.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Now go on, find out who *really* di..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: Now go on, find out who *really* did it.
links.polish: No już, dowiedz się, kto to zrobił *naprawdę*.
links.belarusian: Ну ўжо, даведайцеся, хто гэта зрабіў *насамрэч*.

links.title: You: "Love did them in."
links.english: Love did them in.
links.polish: Miłość ich tak urządziła.
links.belarusian: Каханне іх так уладкавала.

links.title: You: "The dirty police captain?"
links.english: The dirty police captain?
links.polish: Skorumpowany kapitan policji?
links.belarusian: Сацыяльна дэградаваны капітан міліцыі?

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Could be. Who knows? Only one way t..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: Could be. Who knows? Only one way to find out.
links.polish: Może tak. Kto wie? Jest tylko jeden sposób, aby się przekonać.
links.belarusian: Можа быць. Хто ведае? Ёсць толькі адзін спосаб, каб пераканацца.

links.title: You: "Finish the book."
links.english: Finish the book.
links.polish: Dokończ książkę.
links.belarusian: Скончы кнігу.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "You begin furiously flipping throug..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: You begin furiously flipping through pages. Even as you know these books follow a series of well-worn tropes, you find yourself completely engrossed. You're turning pages so fast you don't even notice the ancient spine coming unglued...
links.polish: Zaczynasz gwałtownie przeglądać książkę. Choć wiesz, że ta seria jest tylko zbieraniną absolutnie sztampowych motywów, wciągnąłeś się w fabułę bez reszty. Przerzucasz strony tak szybko, że nie zauważasz, jak stary grzbiet powoli się rozkleja...
links.belarusian: Вы пачынаеце імкліва праглядаць кнігу. Хоць вы ведаеце, што гэтая серыя ўсяго толькі сукупнасць абсалютна штампавых матываў, вас захапіла сюжэтам да канца. Вы перагортваеце старонкі так хутка, што не заўважаеце, як стары пераплёт павольна развальваецца...

links.title: Reaction Speed: "You try to grab the pages as they c..."
links.english: You try to grab the pages as they come loose but your fingers aren't quick enough... they're gone.
links.polish: Próbujesz łapać odpadające strony, ale twoje palce są zbyt powolne... Na nic się to nie zdaje.
links.belarusian: Вы спрабуеце лавіць адпадаючыя старонкі, але вашы пальцы занадта павольныя... Гэта ні да чаго не прыводзіць.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Dozens of pages scatter across the..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: Dozens of pages scatter across the ground. The last fifth or so of the book seems to have been lost. It's possible that you could gather and reassemble the pages, but it would take way too long.
links.polish: Na ziemi leżą dziesiątki stron. Ostatnia część książki, mniej więcej jedna piąta, rozsypała się. Możliwe, że udałoby ci się zebrać strony i je poukładać na nowo, ale zajęłoby to o wiele za długo.
links.belarusian: На зямлі ляжаць дзясяткі старонак. Апошняя частка кнігі, прыкладна адна пятая, рассыпалася. Магчыма, табе ўдалося б сабраць старонкі і зноў іх упарадкаваць, але гэта заняло б занадта шмат часу.

links.title: You: ""Stupid old horse glue.""
links.english: "Stupid old horse glue."
links.polish: „Głupi, badziewny koński klej”.
links.belarusian: "Дурны, дрэнны конскі клей".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Ah, yes. The problem with mass mar..."
links.english: "Ah, yes. The problem with mass market paperbacks... They're not made to last..."
links.polish: „Ach, tak. Typowe dla produkowanych masowo miękkich okładek... Trwałe to one nie są...”
links.belarusian: "Ах, так. Тыпова для выпускаемых масава мяккіх вокладак... Трывалыя яны не ёсць..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Perhaps this is a sign that you sh..."
links.english: "Perhaps this is a sign that you should get back to solving your own murder, eh, detective?"
links.polish: „Może to znak, że powinniśmy zająć się naszą własną sprawą morderstwa, co detektywie?”
links.belarusian: "Можа, гэта знак, што мы павінны заняцца ўласнай справай аб забойстве, што, дэтэктыве?"

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Yes, blame a dead horse for your fa..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: Yes, blame a dead horse for your fat, clumsy fingers.
links.polish: Tak, obwiniaj martwego konia o to, że masz tłuste i niezdarne paluchy.
links.belarusian: Так, абвінавачвай мёртвага каня ў тым, што ў цябе тлустыя і няўклюдныя пальцы.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Don't forget, it could have been th..."
links.english: Don't forget, it could have been the *delirium tremens*.
links.polish: Nie zapominaj, że mogło to być też *delirium tremens*.
links.belarusian: Не забудзь, што гэта магло быць таксама *delirium tremens*.

links.title: You: ""Gah! Now I'll never know!""
links.english: "Gah! Now I'll never know!"
links.polish: „Aaa! No i się nie dowiem!”
links.belarusian: "Ааа! Ну і не даведаюся!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Too bad, detective. If it's any co..."
links.english: "Too bad, detective. If it's any consolation, the resolution is almost never very satisfying..."
links.polish: „Przykro mi, detektywie. Nie wiem, czy cię to pocieszy, ale rozwiązanie zagadki prawie nigdy nie jest zbyt satysfakcjonujące...”
links.belarusian: "Прабачце, дэтэктыў. Не ведаю, ці суцешыць вас гэта, але разгадка галаваломкі амаль ніколі не бывае занадта задавальняючай..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""And on that note, perhaps we shoul..."
links.english: "And on that note, perhaps we should get back to making sense of our own case?"
links.polish: „Nawiasem mówiąc, może powinniśmy wracać do rozwiązania naszego własnego śledztwa?”
links.belarusian: "Дарэчы, можа, нам варта вярнуцца да вырашэння нашага ўласнага расследавання?"

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "That's right. You never will. But t..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: That's right. You never will. But then, isn't that how it is in real life, detective?
links.polish: Zgadza się. Ale czy nie tak wygląda również prawdziwe życie, detektywie?
links.belarusian: Так, гэта праўда. Але хіба не гэтак жа выглядае і сапраўднае жыццё, дэтэктыве?

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Last year, more than 71% of murders..."
links.english: Last year, more than 71% of murders in Revachol went unsolved. In Revachol West, that number was closer to 85%.
links.polish: 71% spraw w Revacholu dotyczących morderstwa nie zostało rozwiązanych. W Zachodnim Revacholu odsetek ten był bliższy 85%.
links.belarusian: 71% спраў у Рэвашолі, якія тычыліся забойстваў, не было вырашана. У Заходнім Рэвашолі гэты паказчык быў бліжэй да 85%.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Dozens of pages scatter across the..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: Dozens of pages scatter across the floor. The last fifth or so of the book seems to have been lost. It's possible that you could gather and reassemble the pages, but it would take way too long.
links.polish: Na podłodze leżą dziesiątki stron. Ostatnia część książki, mniej więcej jedna piąta, rozsypała się. Możliwe, że udałoby ci się zebrać strony i je poukładać na nowo, ale zajęłoby to o wiele za długo.
links.belarusian: На падлозе ляжаць дзясяткі старонак. Апошняя частка кнігі, прыкладна адна пятая, рассыпалася. Магчыма, табе ўдалося б сабраць старонкі і перакласці іх наноў, але гэта заняло б занадта шмат часу.

links.title: You: "The junkie art collector?"
links.english: The junkie art collector?
links.polish: Narkoman kolekcjoner sztuki?
links.belarusian: Наркаман калекцыянер мастацтва?

links.title: You: "The politician's twat son?"
links.english: The politician's twat son?
links.polish: Pizdowaty synek polityka?
links.belarusian: Сын палітыка з праблемамі на скуры?

links.title: You: "Uh... Dick Mullen?"
links.english: Uh... Dick Mullen?
links.polish: Yyy... Dick Mullen?
links.belarusian: Эээ... Дык Маллен?

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Have you been paying attention *at..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: Have you been paying attention *at all*? It wasn't Mullen! It. Was. An. Imposter. Now go on, find out who *really* did it.
links.polish: Czy ty *w ogóle* śledziłeś fabułę? To nie był Mullen! Tylko ktoś, kto się pod niego *podszył*. No, to już, dowiedz się, kto to zrobił *naprawdę*.
links.belarusian: Ці ты *ўвогуле* сачыў за сюжэтам? Гэта быў не Мулен! А нехта, хто за яго *выдаваў сябе*. Так, зараз, даведайся, хто гэта зрабіў *насамрэч*.

links.title: You: "You know what? I don't even care. (..."
links.english: You know what? I don't even care. (Close the book.)
links.polish: Wiesz co? W sumie to mnie to nie obchodzi. (Zamknij książkę).
links.belarusian: Ведаеш што? Увогуле гэта мяне не хвалюе. (Закрый кнігу).

links.title: You: "Can't trust a dame. (Shake your hea..."
links.english: Can't trust a dame. (Shake your head.)
links.polish: Kobietom nie można ufać. (Pokręć głową).
links.belarusian: Жанчыны нельга давяраць. (Пахітай галавой).

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Who can you trust in this wicked, m..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: Who can you trust in this wicked, messed-up world?
links.polish: Komu można ufać w tym podłym, upadłym świecie?
links.belarusian: Каму можна давяраць у гэтым падлым, заняпалым свеце?

links.title: You: "Your partner. (Look at Kim.)"
links.english: Your partner. (Look at Kim.)
links.polish: Swojemu partnerowi. (Spójrz na Kima).
links.belarusian: Свайму партнёру. (Паглядзі на Кіма).

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant gives you a quizzica..."
links.english: The lieutenant gives you a quizzical expression in return. You go back to the story...
links.polish: Porucznik odpowiada ci pytającym spojrzeniem. Ponownie skupiasz się na książce...
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант адказвае табе пытаючым позіркам. Зноў засяроджваешся на кнізе...

links.title: You: "No one. Just your own two eyes."
links.english: No one. Just your own two eyes.
links.polish: Nikomu. Tylko własnej parze oczu.
links.belarusian: Нікому. Толькі ўласнай пары вачэй.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "That's exactly what Dick Mullen say..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: That's exactly what Dick Mullen says in "The Dame Who Did It."
links.polish: Dokładnie to samo mówi Dick Mullen w „Damie winowajczyni”.
links.belarusian: Дакладна тое самае кажа Дык Мулен у "Даме-віннаватай".

links.title: Perception (Sight): "Unfortunately, *your* eyes might no..."
links.english: Unfortunately, *your* eyes might not be up to the task. Speaking of... should you maybe consider getting corrective lenses? Your nose is like two centimetres from the page.
links.polish: Niestety, *twoje* oczy mogą się do tego nie nadawać. A skoro o tym mowa... Może powinieneś pomyśleć o okularach korekcyjnych? Trzymasz książkę jakieś dwa centymetry od strony.
links.belarusian: На жаль, *твае* вочы могуць для гэтага не падыходзіць. А калі ўжо на гэта пайшло... Можа быць, ты павінен падумаць пра карэкцыйныя акуляры? Ты трымаеш кнігу недзе два сантыметры ад старонкі.

links.title: You: "No way. I'm no binoclard."
links.english: No way. I'm no binoclard.
links.polish: Mowy nie ma. Nie jestem pinglarzem.
links.belarusian: Мовы няма. Я не мастак.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "Whatever you say, Detective Hyperop..."
links.english: Whatever you say, Detective Hyperopia. Why don't you get back to the story?
links.polish: Jak uważasz, detektywie Krótkowzroczność. Może tak wrócimy do fabuły?
links.belarusian: Як лічыш, дэтэктыў Каротказорнасць. Можа, вернемся да сюжэту?

links.title: You: "Uh, I'll think about it. Better get..."
links.english: Uh, I'll think about it. Better get on with the story first.
links.polish: Hmm, przemyślę to. Ale najpierw zajmę się lepiej fabułą.
links.belarusian: Хм, я перадумаю. Але спачатку лепш займуся сюжэтам.

links.title: You: "No one. You gotta go with your gut."
links.english: No one. You gotta go with your gut.
links.polish: Nikomu. Trzeba ufać rodzącym się w bebechu przeczuciom.
links.belarusian: Нікому. Трэба давяраць прадчуванням, якія нараджаюцца ў нутры.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "That's exactly what Dick Mullen say..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: That's exactly what Dick Mullen says in "Dauntless Dick and the Fatal Appointment."
links.polish: Dokładnie to samo mówi Dick Mullen w „Niezłomnym Dicku i śmiertelnej wizycie”.
links.belarusian: Менавіта гэта кажа Дык Мулен у "Незламным Дыку і смяротным візіце".

links.title: Endurance: "Speaking of, *your* gut's seen bett..."
links.english: Speaking of, *your* gut's seen better days. It's a cesspool of burbling acids and noxious fumes, the kind of thing the government might declare a Zone of Irredeemable Catastrophe.
links.polish: Nawiasem mówiąc, *twój* bebech pamięta lepsze czasy. Teraz jest tam tylko mieszanina burzących się kwasów i trujących oparów. Miejscem, które rząd mógłby ogłosić strefą nieodwołalnej katastrofy.
links.belarusian: Дарэчы, *твай* унутранасці памятаюць лепшыя часы. Цяпер там толькі змешванне бураных кіслот і атрутных пароў. Месца, якое ўрад мог бы абвясціць зонай непазбежнай катастрофы.

links.title: You: "Why is my gut in such bad shape?"
links.english: Why is my gut in such bad shape?
links.polish: Czemu mój bebech jest w takim złym stanie?
links.belarusian: Чаму мой жывот у такім дрэнным стане?

links.title: Endurance: "Could it be an underlying condition..."
links.english: Could it be an underlying condition aggravated by years of greasy meals scarfed down between shifts? Or the litres upon litres of hard liquor guzzled on an empty stomach?
links.polish: Może przez jakieś dawne schorzenie pogłębione przez lata tłustego jedzenia pochłanianego naprędce między zmianami w pracy? Albo wieloma litrami wypijanych na pustych żołądek mocnych trunków?
links.belarusian: Можа, з-за якога-небудзь даўняга захворвання, паглыбленага гадамі тоўстай ежы, ужыванай паспешліва паміж зменамі на працы? Альбо шматлікімі літрамі моцных напояў, выпіваных на пусты страўнік?

links.title: Endurance: "No point in worrying about it just..."
links.english: No point in worrying about it just now. Why don't you get back to the story?
links.polish: Nie ma sensu się tym teraz martwić. Może tak wrócimy do fabuły?
links.belarusian: Няма сэнсу турбавацца пра гэта зараз. Мо вернемся да сюжэту?

links.title: You: "Don't you sass me. Get on with the..."
links.english: Don't you sass me. Get on with the story.
links.polish: Nie cwaniakuj mi tu. Skup się na fabule.
links.belarusian: Не выхвальвайся тут. Сканцэнтруйся на сюжэце.

links.title: You: "Your partner. Kim will be there for..."
links.english: Your partner. Kim will be there for me.
links.polish: Partnerowi. Kim będzie mnie wspierał.
links.belarusian: Партнёру. Хто будзе мяне падтрымліваць.

links.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Will *you* be there for *him*, thou..."
links.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
links.english: Will *you* be there for *him*, though, when push comes to shove? Time will tell. In the meantime, let's get on with the story...
links.polish: Ale czy *ty* będziesz wspierał *jego*, jak przyjdzie co do czego? Czas pokaże. A na razie skupmy się znów na fabule...
links.belarusian: Але ці *ты* будзеш падтрымліваць *яго*, калі прыйдзе да справы? Час пакажа. А пакуль засяродзімся зноў на сюжэце...

links.title: You: "I don't really like where this is g..."
links.english: I don't really like where this is going. (Close the book.)
links.polish: Nie podoba mi się, do czego to zmierza. (Zamknij książkę).
links.belarusian: Мне не падабаецца, да чаго гэта вядзе. (Закрый кнігу).

links.title: You: "I'm not sure I'm happy with this, b..."
links.english: I'm not sure I'm happy with this, but maybe the story will turn it around.
links.polish: Nie wiem, czy mi się to podoba, ale może fabuła jakoś to wytłumaczy.
links.belarusian: Я не ведаю, ці мне гэта падабаецца, але, магчыма, сюжэт неяк гэта патлумачыць.

links.title: You: "I feel like I've read this before...."
links.english: I feel like I've read this before. (Close the book.)
links.polish: Mam wrażenie, jakbym już to kiedyś czytał. (Zamknij książkę).
links.belarusian: У мяне такое ўражанне, што я ўжо калісьці гэта чытаў. (Закрый кнігу).

links.title: You: "Keep reading."
links.english: Keep reading.
links.polish: Czytaj dalej.
links.belarusian: Чытай далей.

links.title: You: "I don't need to read this. I'm alre..."
links.english: I don't need to read this. I'm already living it. (Close the book.)
links.polish: Nie muszę tego czytać. Własne życie mam na co dzień. (Zamknij książkę).
links.belarusian: Я не мушу гэтага чытаць. Уласнае жыццё я маю штодня. (Закрый кнігу).

links.title: You: "[Put the book away.]"
links.english: Modus: Mullen.
links.polish: Modus: Mullen.
links.belarusian: Модус: Маллен.

links.title: You: "[Put the book away.]"
links.english: [Put the book away.]
links.polish: [Odłóż książkę].
links.belarusian: [Адкладзіце кнігу].

dialogueTree.title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "In your hand, you hold "Dick Mullen..."
dialogueTree.actor: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity
dialogueTree.english: In your hand, you hold "Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity." The brittle paperback feels fragile to the touch.
dialogueTree.polish: W dłoni trzymasz książkę „Dick Mullen i pomylona tożsamość”. Sypiący się tom w miękkiej okładce wydaje się niesamowicie delikatny.
dialogueTree.belarusian: У руках трымаеш кнігу "Дык Маллен і заблытаная асоба". Занядбаны том у мяккай вокладцы здаецца надзвычай далікатным.
